items.abstract: <jats:p>In this paper we introduce an exponential continuous-time GARCH(<jats:italic>p</jats:italic>, <jats:italic>q</jats:italic>) process. It is defined in such a way that it is a continuous-time extension of the discrete-time EGARCH(<jats:italic>p</jats:italic>, <jats:italic>q</jats:italic>) process. We investigate stationarity, mixing, and moment properties of the new model. An instantaneous leverage effect can be shown for the exponential continuous-time GARCH(<jats:italic>p</jats:italic>, <jats:italic>p</jats:italic>) model.</jats:p>
title: An Exponential Continuous-Time GARCH Process
